intro: Waltheria excelsa, commonly known as the tall spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Waltheria excelsa produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
